intro: Homalium austrocaledonicum, commonly known as the New Caledonia homalium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the island of New Caledonia, where it grows in moist, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, red or orange flowers that appear in clusters. It is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native region. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
